comments.body: I love this idea, but I feel that it needs to have something to make players want to use it instead of just enchanting their gear with an enchantment table. I would recommend that the enchantment levels would increase on the item, but it would come with more curses. For example, if you used 30 levels the maximum currently you can get is a level 5 enchantment but with this cursed enchantment table it would allow you to get 7 or at a maximum of 10 with a curse or two.
There is also a 5% chance of obtaining experience orbs.
крутая идея
I agree, we need more leaf varieties other than green. Brown wilted leaves and cherry blossom leaves would look great in builds and biomes!

I absolutely agree, pink and white cherry blossom leaves and red, orange, yellow, and brown autumn leaves would be wonderful to be able to build with! We really can’t achieve the look of seasons with existing blocks except on a massive scale. Hedges would be wonderful as well because when building at player scale leaf blocks look too “chunky” as hedges, especially when using stone walls anywhere nearby. Leaf layers/leaf carpets would be beautiful for decoration, too, currently I use a leaf block in the ground and it only kind of works in dim lighting when surrounded by moss blocks, otherwise it’s very obviously not realistic because it looks like you should fall through.

I'm rather tired of relying on mods to make autumn trees, or doing them individually. I've been hoping for autumn trees for years.

Love the idea of a leaf carpet layer.
jeez
Please
What is a spectral arrow?
A spectral arrow is used for tracking mobs and enchants them with glowing for I think 10 seconds

c'est vrai que ça pourrait être intéressant de créer des flèches via la fletching table ,

mais si ça ce fait il faudrait que la flèche spectrale ne soie pas la seule a être craftable via cette table.

on pourrait par exemple avoir l'ajout de la flèche explosive tant attendue ou pouvoir y crafter les flèches a effets.
This would also be cool to be the way tipped arrows are made.  It would cause problems though...
why?
I guess I was thinking of this from the perspective of all tipped arrows, not just spectral arrows.  My bad
Ok
yeah, I guess there should be a use for the fletching table, it is only used for villager professions, it is kind of useless. It isn't a bad idea.

This already happens, at least in Bedrock addition. I wouldn't know about Java addition. To switch out your armor, you just hold another armor piece in your hand and right click/left trigger to swap them.
Yeah I really don't get why this isn't already in the game. it would make things a lot easier same with shift clicking armor when in inventory it should swap too.
Sorry But this is already in the game
Yeah this doesn't work in Java.  It's quite frustrating!
*breaks the chest*
Yeaaaaaah
Yeaaaaaaaah
Yes please do this I hate being treated like a item farm
also make it so that only the creator can break it and if you are not the creator it will take the time to break diamond ore with your fist

I think a lot when I'm playing multiplayer.
There are people who steal things and hard to find the culprit.
It is necessary when playing under rules that prohibit the use of commands.
（I am Japanese. Is this English correct?）
Thats a good idea
Good, but might be hard to program, because the hitting distance was added over a decade ago.
It is Bad because if you can hit me even before I get the cance to Hit you back because of My hitting distance it would look like cheating
it shouldn't be for swords it should be for items with elongated handles like axes hoes and shovels

If water levels have different heights, water buckets could hold different levels of water. I imagine this would be indicated with a sort of HP bar. Shifting while filling/emptying would fill/empty the entire block instead of one level at a time.

The height of the still water block determines how far the water can flow. When the moon comes out and the water level rises, the water would be able to flow farther, and when the moon leaves the water would recede
This would definitely help protect your bases! Also, maybe there should be an ‘electric’ status effect which does more than just deal damage?
Maybe if it used lightning rods, instead of redstone. Also, if they are electrified, it should be subtle, like a trapped chest compared to a normal chest.
son nueve, pero bueno
Hmmmm interesting

Hi! It looks like there's something very similar in subject, it's a list, has a previously rejected idea, is a bug or support issue, exists, or too general.  Check out this link (https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/360004442111-Creating-Great-Ideas), search (https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/360035667771-Making-Great-Searches-on-the-Feedback-Site-), & join existing threads in progress (we read ALL the comments).

It is interesting idea. The problem with helding torches and probably mining helmets is the dinamic lighting. Also this is why glow squid won't probably glow... But getting effect of night vision is nice idea.
And if Minecraft has a problem with you needing to kill the Glow squid to get that dye than maybe make the Glow Squid drop the dye when you give him from example Seaweed
Man, i had that same diea XD. I think it should also need some glowstone (maybe even gloowstine blocks??) for the recipe so that players can't get the helmet at least until they go to the Nether.
Just like almost all of the ever biome dependant plants in MC like grasses, vines, most leaves and the like! Would be greatfor building
I think that this is a great idea and there can also be the brushes for the dig sites and also some amethyst and they can also include a copper giant as the "protector" of this treasure
I am angry I cannot give you 2 votes!, great idea as ocean ruins are kind of boring. great idea and I hope a developer sees it it as the ocean could also get deeper now that the world is.
I vote this because I feel like it could add a new style of decorating to minecraft

Crystal block could also be a block too. It will be a reflective block kinda like a mirror but its not completely reflective and doesn't produce a mirrored image like a mirror does. It would be crafted using 8 crystal shards surrounding a piece of dye so we would have different colored crystal blocks. I also think the crystal shard can be used to make colored lamps, torches, lanterns, and other lights sources to make the produce a certain color of light. this can be made with one crystal, a piece of dye, and a light source like a torch.
What if its just more resistant to tnt, otherwise I dont see the point of this
Ooh that would be cool!
this is great i"ve always wanted that sort of pattern in my builds!
I love this idea! It's a simple mechanic, but it fits in well with the rest of the game, and could add some new decoration options.
Did you mean to say planet?

but, players can already look at plants. Perhaps you meant "planets"?

they could probably make some cool mechanics my making astrology a thing, where seeing stellar bodies mattered
Maybe you should add a new item called a Telescope to see planets and stars in the sky. It's crafted with Spyglass so it's not that useless like everyone says it.

Please add or rework the enchanting mechanic with the combat update. I feel like the system has so much potential and is in need of a rehaul. I love the direction that Minecraft is going in and hiring the modder behind aether is an amazing move. I hope that more of the modding community will be involved with the development of the main game. Thanks for the hard work.
Iots a great idea maybe bedrock could get sweeping edge
I think If it gets added it should be really hard to get as max gear is already really good.

i thought of something that could be included in this. i thought that there should be a way to get bottles of enchanting. so i thought. “what if there was an enchantment block that if you stand on top of, it’ll take away exp from you and put it in bottles. you can get the exp back by throwing it on you but if you have no levels, it’ll just be enough to get to level 1.there could be an extra slot in things like grindstones, enchantment tables or any block/item that uses exp for exp bottles to go in(just in case your too lazy to splash yourself) maybe they replace things like flame and fire aspect because they do the same thing to one enchantment.maybe called burning strike.
Wow 6 upvote thx guys
I like how it is always a trade off. Curses could also lower attack speed, base damage, player reach distance, etc.
If it would be funny if you found one already named dinnerbone. 🤣
This is a good excuse to get rid of tnt duplicators I love it!
I definitely support the route of being able to convert gravel into sand.

I supported this a while back, and while a lot are focused on TnT, my reason was for concrete.
Piglin Bartering gives renewable gravel, and other half of concrete is sand.
I think the game would struggle to make this work. Simulated physics algorithms would have to be implemented, or the vines would never stop swinging, for example.
PlutonicPoet34 But from the other hand it could work similar with the rope
I like the idea, but given Minecraft's blocky premise, it may be hard to implement.

@IHN031 I would love to see ropes added too, but unless they really commit to this function, I don't think it'll work. Imagine a 100 block tall vine being swung, and the current system lagging out. If it were to be added, a lot would have to be changed. I'm not against it, I'm just stating that fact.

Idk about stronger than netherite but I would like for it to be maybe stronger than diamond and found only in the overworld maybe more common than diamond but with less enchant ability in the enchantment table. But cool idea non the less, I've wanted steel and titanium for a long time in minecraft along with copper and bronze I think adding to the amount of ores or just materials we can make armor and tools out of would really increase the amount of options you could use in your minecraft world.
Beautiful, but i prefer this progression: stone -> copper -> bronze -> iron -> steel -> titanium -> diamond -> netherite -> graphene, or a ore found in the end
Like a mininghelmet
I'd rather just use a torch or lantern, things we already have in the game that aren't gimmicky.
But what would it's armor level be? And what enchantments could you put on it? Or maybe it could just be a new enchantment that you can put on helmets to make it glow
Pretty Cool Idea! Except i do think that the enchant should be called Magnetism Rather than telekinesis, just to not get any attention from Hypixel Skyblock.
It would be a nice mod but it wouldn't fit in survival minecarft
Paras
Bonemeal + Wood Plank (as sticks do not differentiate) = Wood Chips/ Mulch....if left as 'Wood Chips' you could use them for décor...and cooking; get a flavor when smoking.

Why not have both wood-chips & mulch!? Wood chips are thicker, & you could customize things better. Maybe they should only be crafted with sawmills, (which should also come along with lumberjacks). If not, surround an axe by planks, using only 1 durability. They should maybe even be affected by gravity. Assuming you mean they would be full blocks. It would be cool if there were blocks & layers of wood chips & mulch. Might as well allow the blocks to craft all the same wood items as you can with planks. In general it would be great to build out of "broken wood," like cracked bricks.
